title: Bronze....
body:
last few games, i've had inting players, troll picks and afks.

I report them as per usual

I play best on my team most of the time, and still end up losing, is there a way to escape this, i did it last season from b5 in 300 games.

However this season no luck. I play mostly supp and mid and tend to win lane pretty easily (solo without adc, because they suck)

WHAT DO I DO. IT'S NEAR IMPOSSIBLE TO AVOID, I CAN'T CARRY TRASH...

replies.body: There are certain champions that can carry hard in a 1v5 situation. Support champions aren't any of them.

From playing with my friends who come from a range of elo's from a bronze-silver top to a high platinum support, this is not really true. You've obviously never seen a fully stacked mejais full ap zyra, annie or sona, sh*t's terrifying.

Not supports. Mages that can cheese their way into that role don't count. Plus even when you have Brand support, they have to waste a little gold and give up the pressure of mid lane which is why they will only shine in team fights, unless they are fed enough to 1v1 the enemy adc. Annie would probably be the best candidate, and Zyra is very strong, but they can't carry in a 1v5 situation because at least some of them is dependent upon setting something up, they can't carry the way a Nasus or something can.

One of my friends is a platinum support main and the rest of us are bronze to low silver (I'm probably around low bronze last I checked) but he can still carry 4 of us so hard that we can beat full teams of mid gold players when he plays thresh or zyra through making picks, raw damage and cc, and shotcalling with or without voicecoms (using pings and ingame chat).

It is quite possible to 1v5 hard carry bronzies without playing a hyper carry solo laner (I won't lie, it helps), though admittedly you have to be really good to do so and also have a good amount of contempt for your teammates so that you don't begin to rely on them.

Ok, but my point is if you were all afk he couldn't carry. Even though he is doing everything, he can't do enough damage or push hard enough to carry, he needs his team to do stuff no matter how bad they are. I'm not saying it has to be a hyper solo carry laner, but someone like Thresh can't 1 one shot someone and can't split push, they can only land godlike hooks and plays which as a result carry the game, but it's not a 1v5 situation.

Chill out in norms.

But yeah, idk either.

But i enjoy ranked (when i get decent teams both enemy and allied) if only there was a way short of boosting to avoid cancerous bronze

or play an assassin jungler and dominate. I have never seen a role where the difference in game pressure from a single player can change so much depending on elo. The difference between a bronze and even just silver assassin jungler is dramatic and silver assassin junglers can carry so hard in bronze games, despite not being all that much higher elo.

> But i enjoy ranked (when i get decent teams both enemy and allied) if only there was a way short of boosting to avoid cancerous bronze

After you win your lane, how bout you help them out out win theirs? You dont have to group for the sake of grouping.

I would say 'Git gud', but your not the only person going through this, as I'm in bronze also, and well, it's not fucking fun.
Anyway, my advice is to play Ranked Flex, it's more leaning to the people you play against in normals.

So E.G: You vs silvers (and/or low ranked golds), you will likely be paired with low silvers or high bronzes, meanwhile in Solo Queue you'll just vs bronze 5 %%%s which leans towards your MMR.

It's working for me, I mean I vs'd a Plat top lane, and won :D   I was the only bronze person in that whole entire match.
Hope this helps. In some way. Yeah...
